step.cmd: Make a copy of the file 1_new_task.dita and open it in your editor.

info.note: If you are using a DITA-aware text editor, make sure you are in text mode, rather than Author or visual mode.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "task.dtd"> <task id="my_first_task">
</task>

info.p: The first line (which begins with <?xml) is an XML declaration, which is a standard part of all XML files.

The second line is the DOCTYPE declaration, which tells DITA editors or DITA output generators that this is a DITA strict topic. The programs then use that information when validating the content of the topic.

step.cmd: Inside the <task> element, add a <title> element, and add the task title.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "task.dtd"> <task id="my_first_task"> <title>(TEXT TBD)</title>
</task>

step.info: As you have probably read before, the <taskbody> contains all the actual content in the task.

stepxmp.pre:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE task PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Task//EN" "task.dtd"> <task id="my_first_task"> <title>(TEXT TBD)</title> <taskbody>
</taskbody> </task>
